result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:02 PM Tanner M. Marko appears in Court,  Atty Liesl E. Nelson appeared in court, ADA Kaley Walker appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF147 (PH) and 22CT44 (STC). DE would like to waive the PH. Court questions DE and reviews his rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. 22CT44 to follow.

3:18 PM Defendant Tanner M. Marko in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson. Defendant Tanner M. Marko in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. DE does qualify for PD. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of   Maintain absolute sobriety. & not to possess, no objection. Court so orders. Waive the time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court will reset 22CT44 to follow. Court adjourned at 3:25 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
